SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Ironclad Ventures relative to Vanguard Dynamics?
SRP.A: Ironclad Ventures is {below} Vanguard Dynamics in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total customer acquisition cost?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {Vanguard Dynamics}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total customer acquisition cost?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Apex Systems}.

VE.Q: What are the customer acquisition cost of Vanguard Dynamics, Apex Systems, and Ironclad Ventures in 1968?

SC.Q: What is the average total Customer Acquisition Cost?

NC.Q: Was the total Customer Acquisition Cost in 1970 higher or lower than in 1973?
NC.A: The total customer acquisition cost in 1970 was {lower} than in 1973.

NC.Q: Was the total Customer Acquisition Cost in 1971 higher or lower than in 1973?
NC.A: The total customer acquisition cost in 1971 was {lower} than in 1973.

NC.Q: Between 1970 and 1974, did the total Customer Acquisition Cost experience a larger or smaller change than between 1974 and 1976?
NC.A: The change in total customer acquisition cost between 1970 and 1974 was {larger} than between 1974 and 1976.

NC.Q: Between 1970 and 1972, was the average total Customer Acquisition Cost higher or lower than between 1976 and 1977?
NC.A: The average total customer acquisition cost between 1970 and 1972 was {lower} than between 1976 and 1977.

MSR.Q: Which series has the largest cumulative area in this area chart?
MSR.A: {Vanguard Dynamics} has the largest cumulative area.

VA.Q: To reduce the 'waving' visual effect in the area chart, reorder the layers by end value and list the labels from top to bottom after sorting.
VA.A: The reordered layer order from top to bottom is: {Apex Systems, Ironclad Ventures, Horizon Enterprises, Vanguard Dynamics}.
